headline: Creamy Chocolate Frosting
description: This milk chocolate frosting is a smooth and creamy, 5-ingredient chocolate buttercream that's simple to make and great for icing cake and cupcakes.

video.description: See how to make yummy chocolate frosting for cakes and cupcakes.
video.name: Creamy Chocolate Frosting

name: Creamy Chocolate Frosting
recipeIngredient: 6 tablespoons unsalted butter, at room temperature

recipeInstructions.text: Sift together confectioners' sugar and cocoa powder in a medium bowl.
Cream butter in a large bowl until smooth. Gradually beat in sugar mixture alternately with evaporated milk. Blend in vanilla.
Beat mixture on high speed until light and fluffy. Adjust consistency with more milk or sugar, if desired.

review.reviewBody: I always make homemade frosting. This is a no brainer recipe with so many options. I didn’t want to open a can of evaporated milk ‘cause what are you going to do with the rest of the can? I had half and half on hand. I used salted butter and I cut back on the amount. I didn’t want to use 2 3/4 powdered sugar but I used 2 cups. The possibilities for adjustments are there! Heck, I didn’t even sift the sugar and cocoa. I just threw everything together! It’s a great recipe and it’s so good!
I loved this cake!!! It was super easy to make! It was moist and light. The chocolate frosting here was a perfect match to make a rich and decadent dessert! Thank you!

Reading the reviews I had to alter a little, by adding another 1/4 cup flour and cut from milk. It came Perfect . Sturdy enought to layer the cake. I bake it in 2 round pans. I mixed heavy wipcrea with a packet of cocoa pudding to fill and dress . Waiting for it to cool so I can decorate .

The only changes I made was to use one whole stick of melted butter and used cream in place of milk, 2/3 cup King Arthur double Dutch dark cocoa. This perfectly frosted a two layer cake with nothing left over. I did add a spoonful of milk to mix in towards the end of frosting since it was setting up, making it hard to spread.
I almost died when I tasted this delicious-ness! Highly recommended!
Fantastic frosting highly recommended, very creamy Susan B

I went a little extra on the cocoa powder, also added 1/2 stick melted butter, used cold coffee instead of milk and also added approx 1/3 cup cream cheese. The texture and flavor improved with these changes.
Easy and delicious. Perfect amount for my chocolate cake.

I have made this recipe for over 50 years. Through the years I have got a little heavy handed with the vanilla, it bumps up the flavor and I agree with other viewers, I use salted butter. I wish somehow you all could hear the complements I have gotten on this frosting. It's easy and I always have the ingredients on hand. A Family Favorite Rated :) :) :) :) :)

I have modified this recipe quite a bit. I used like 3x the cocoa powder, added a couple pinches of salt and reduced the sugar. It's better after it sits for a while. I think I prefer recipes that used melted baker's chocolate, sometimes more of a pain but better taste in the end. This is good if you need something quick but, for sure add more cocoa and some salt.

I loved the flavor of this frosting, really creamy and not too rich. I added two extra tablespoons of butter accidentally but that probably made it more delicious! Lol I only used 4 tablespoons of evaporated milk.
It's simple It's awesome i dont have much to say about it but i suggest to add 2 more tbsp of evaporated milk all in all really good icing.
Love it!!! But if you change to salt butter. Will test better. Trust me!!
Lol
Easy and yummy.
Came out great was enough to frost a single layer cake and 12 cupcakes. Not too sweet which I prefer.
The consistency was good, but the flavor was not. It was bland yet slightly sweet and bitter at the same time. I was hoping for a smoother flavor; perhaps my tastbuds have changed 🤔
My kids enjoyed it so much they ate the little bit that was left over. It was just about the perfect amount. I added 4 tablespoons of evaporated milk and 1/2 a cup of powdered sugar
Delicious - I did double the recipe as others said it didn't make enough. I had leftovers after filling/frosting a double layer 9" cake.

I really like this recipe as my wife & kids did as well. She doesn't like overly sweet frosting but this came out perfect. 2-9 inches cakes and there was enough to frost the middle and outside. I substituted half&half for the evaporated milk and honestly will continue to do so. This will now be my goto for chocolate frosting
Awesome!!! The best frosting ever!!
Chocolate perfection! Perfect consistency. Frosted a 9” single layer cake.

Thank you so much, Tracy Larsen!! This is the best frosting we’ve ever had. It is so delicious that my kids now insist on your recipe for every chocolate cake we every make. Thank you for sharing this!!!
i went to go put this on my cake and it was SO bitter and awful and i went back and re reed the directions and i followed them exactly as told, so awful
This recipe is excellent both in texture and taste. I made it exactly as written and it piped out beautifully onto my cupcakes. It’s a keeper!!

This frosting is smooth, rich and creamy. I didn't have any evaporated milk, so I made my own. Just take double the milk and place on your stovetop at medium low for about 25 minutes (don't let it boil!). It will reduce by about half. Then let cool. I had about 1/2 T left over which I just dumped in my morning coffee. I paired this frosting with "Crazy Cake" from this site. I will probably try melted butter next time as Naples34102 suggested to see the difference.

I’ve always had trouble getting the right texture with frostings. This recipe was so easy and super yummy! It’s not thick like the frosting one finds at a bakery; it’s more fluffy like a thick type of cool whip. This will definitely be my “go to” when I’m baking with my kids!
Doesn’t make that much so I had to make a few batches but tastes great with really good texture
This is SO much better than canned frosting and is easy to make. This will be my go-to now!
Most excellent. Substituted 1/2 &1/2 for evaporated milk. Whoever said this recipe portion was not enough needs to buy me a new pair of pants. I ate all of the extra frosting!
Frosting gets EXTREMELY hard - Hard to scrub hard to remove what was left in my mixing bowl. Added some milk to make it smooth but it was not very much to my liking.
Simple, tasty, I used Dark Coco and one teaspoon instant coffee.
quick and easy, made more than I needed to frost 2 dozen cupcakes
This recipe was great. I will use this as my staple from now on.
I really liked frosting. It is not too sweet. I made it with the exact ingredients
LOVED IT
Delicious frosting and simple to make!! Used it for cupcakes and it was divine. I will definitely make this again!
good

Made exactly per recipe. Didn’t change a thing. Doubled it for a 2 layer 9” round cake. Got rave reviews from everyone. My daughter who works in our towns most loved bakery said it was by far the best chocolate frosting she’s ever had. Seriously the best!
This is a really great frosting! I didn’t have evaporated milk, so I used buttermilk and it turned out amazing! Our kids loved it!
Absolutely delicious, & so easy to make!! This will be my go to frosting from now on! Thanks so much for sharing!! Didn’t change a thing....
It was very bitter tasting. I'm not sure if that's because I used whole milk instead canned. I ended up doctoring itto make it sweeter. Texture was fine.
The perfect frosting recipe. Smooth and creamy but not too rich. Two thumbs up!!!

Simple, fast, good for piping, tasty.
No need to sift, there were no lumps without it. Super smooth and creamy. I added more cocoa as I like dark chocolate. I divided the ingredients in 1/2 and just dumped them into the bowl after the butter was creamed, mixed, then dumped the second half. Yes, I am kind of a hack but it still worked beautifully!
So good!!!! And goes so well with vanilla cupcakes!
Best chocolate frosting I ever tasted. Don't buy that frosting in the tub. This is so easy to make and taste way better.
sooooooooooooooooooooo yummy!!!!!!!!!!!
A little toooo sweet for my liking,
This is very tasty and easy to make! Sifting the flour and cocoa takes time but makes it smooth and no "bumps" in the frosting. Delicious!
This was DELICIOUS! I used dark cocoa and milk. This will be my new go to for icing. It was so creamy and easy to spread! Definitely a keeper!
Disturbingly sweet - I may try to double the cocoa and keep sugar amount the same or even lessen it the next time ...
Worked amazing! Super tasteful, some of the best chocolate frosting I've ever had!
This was very creamy. I did substitute half and half instead of evaporated milk.
This is my new go-to chocolate cake frosting recipe. So delicious, classic, and easy!
I used whole milk instead of evaporated milk. It was good, but I didn’t powder the sugar enough so it was crunchy. For next time: be sure to powder the sugar very well
Used half and half instead of evaporated milk. It's very good!
This recipe is absolutely delicious! Made cupcakes for a party and everyone loved it!
A bit too sweet for my taste but the texture was very satisfying; creamy, velvety, and smooth. I will cut down the sugar a bit next time.

Great recipe! I added a pinch of chili powder and a splash of vanilla to add a little depth to the flavor to ensure it would stand up against my dark chocolate cupcakes, and it did not disappoint. Such an easy recipe, and it made the perfect amount for two dozen cupcakes. A keeper!
it tasted great but I had to add 7 cups of powdered sugar instead of 3 and I literarily ran out of powdered sugar so I would sort of recommending this but it is totally a waste of ingredients

I’ve never made frosting before so I’m very happy with how this came out. I doubled the recipe so I could make two dozen of these ice cream cone cupcakes and had quite a bit leftover. I didn’t have the 5.5 cups of confectioners sugar that it called for so I used what I had which was about 4.5 cups and it was plenty sweet. I would probably keep it that way in the future as long as the icing itself doesn’t become too runny from the last of sugar. I’d definitely recommend this recipe.

I absolutely love this frosting! It was so easy to frost the cake with. I doubled the recipe for my 3 layer cake and it worked well. I filled my cake with raspberry filling so i only piped a ring/border around each inner layer and i ended up having a little bit left over. Overall great recipe!!! Thank you
Too soft for cupcakes if you want a firm frosting I suggest you don’t add the evaporated milk or add just two tablespoons
It was great!

Doubled the recipe to frost a 2 Layer Black Magic cake for my wife’s birthday. Also used Hershey’s Special Dark cocoa. Excellent recipe. Added a little more evaporated milk than recipe called for to get the whipped consistency I was looking for. Very tasty!
Super good! This is a keeper!

Made exactly per the recipe and turned out great. When I did a taste test, it seems a bit sugary, but it spread very nicely and held up well. Once on the cake the sweetness seemed more balanced. I may add just a small amount more butter next time, and see how that compares. Used on the Dark German Chocolate Cake recipe.
I used cacoa because that’s what I had on hand. It’s delicious.
My husband love it. Great recipe.
Delicious!!!
Didn’t really change anything. Came out creamy and delicious. Best frosting I’ve made.
So easy and BEST frosting ever!!!!!
Was way too thin
This was so good! very thick and chocolaty
Easy to make and very tasty. I added the milk slowly until it was just right to frost my cake. I baked the Black Magic Cake from this site. Everyone loved it.+

I followed the recipe exactly and it definitely worked! I will be using this recipe again but will use 1/2 of the sugar and a couple pinches of salt. I didn't end up using all of it and it was SOOOOO sweet. Way too sweet for my taste. I added some salt to cut the sweet which worked well (I used salted butter too). My next try I'll cut the sugar by at least 1 cup but keep everything else the same.
I added more evaporated milk so I could drizzle it over a bundt cake. It worked perfectly!

Excellent! We had only dark cocoa powder and was delicious & beautiful dark color. I’m using regular cocoa powder is equally great! Thanks for sharing. My daughter used to frost the sides of the golf cake she made for her grandfather.

I am not a big chocolate frosting user, but I like it on brownies. Last minute cook out lead me to making brownies, had no icing so I came searching. First recipe I find is this one and it was perfect. I made 1 1/2 recipe, had left over so the regular recipe was probably enough . I used a 9x 13 pan. I added a little more powdered sugar for my taste and and extra Tablespoon of milk. I used milk cause I was out of evaporated milk other then that it was perfect.I put it in my favorites for next time, will definitely use again.
This chocolate cake was excellent and Is the only chocolate cake I will be making in the future. Pair it with Homemade creamy chocolate frosting & you’re ready to go.
I used Ovaltine chocolate malt powder and it was great

Aesthetically, this recipe turned out well. We did have to add bits of liquid to get the consistency right. It also made an extraordinary amount, way more than I needed for 1.5 dozen of cupcakes. So it felt lot a lot of waste. In the end, it was way too sweet for us and we couldn't eat it.

Made this today and my husband who is not a chocolate person loved it. I rounded off the ingredients by doing 3 cups of sugar and 1 stick of butter. Turned out great. It frosted 24 cupcakes generously. I think you would need to double if Frosting if doing a two layer cake.

I was not a fan of the recipe. I creamed the butter to perfection and alternated adding the dry mixture and the sweetened condensed milk and it was still like Fudge—not creamy or spreadable at all...so I added 50% more sweetened condensed milk; not much improvement. After adding several tablespoons of 2% milk, I had a frosting...but it was still just a boring, powdered-sugar flavored, not overly creamy frosting that didn’t spread the “best” (or worst) I’d ever worked with (hence a not overly pretty cake). This one was too sweet and not creamy enough for my preference and I don’t even know how others made it workable as written, but maybe that had a bit to do with where you live? It didn’t work well on a cold Midwest day for sure;)
Perfect!!!
Just what we were looking for to pair with a very dense, chocolate cake. We used heavy whipping cream instead of evaporated milk and salted butter.
Wow....very easy and soooo good!

I added a pinch of salt, 2 tablespoons of cocoa in addition to what it calls for and a little more vanilla. I made 1.5 times the recipe to frost a 9inch round cake and added strawberries and toffee chips to the center.
Creamy and delicious. I had plenty for a 9x13 cake and a packaged cake mix of cupcakes with still some left over.
perfect, simple, recommend... I added 1/8 tsp salt, even though I did use salted butter... just do to taste
Best icing I have tasted in a very long time. I used reg milk instead of evaporated. Added it to dry mix until it was the right consistency. Still delicious. Thanks for sharing!
Taste yummy. I highly recomend it

It was good but it definitely isn't enough for a whole cake so I had to make it twice. It's not as fluffy as I hoped it would be, it was hard to put the frosting evenly on the cake but overall it tasted good

Really great. I forgot to add the vanilla and it still tasted amazing. I think the key to success in this recipe is how you treat your butter. Make sure it is softened and allow it to fully whip and fluff (I used an electric stand mixer) before adding other ingredients.
Perfect!!!

Now before I start ranting I do want to say that the frosting tasted yummy and rich... okay... now to (mildly) complain. Me and my family decided to use this recipe to top a chocolate marble cake for Easter, ( I'm not the type of person with the moral of "Oh well the costumers always right" but) We checked the ingredients multiple times and I'm sure we had measured correctly but...alas it was just a liquid mess, not creamy frosting, but liquid chocolate. We applied it to the cake when the cake was cool, so It wasn't that the cake was too hot, and the frosting melted, but that the recipe consistency was a flop. It was however delicious so next time I would just add more cocoa and sugar.
I used heavy whipping cream because it's what I had available. This frosting is the best!!!
Easy & quick to prepare. Delicious to eat! Notice it’s a small batch; double or triple for a layer cake.
It was great! We didn't change a thing and it tasted light and chocolatey. Perfect!
